definitions.text: something that is likely to vary; something that is subject to variation
examples: the weather is one variable to be considered

definitions.text: a quantity that can assume any of a set of values
a star that varies noticeably in brightness
a symbol (like x or y) that is used in mathematical or logical expressions to represent a variable quantity
liable to or capable of change
examples: rainfall in the tropics is notoriously variable
the varying angles of roof slope

definitions.text: (used of a device) designed so that a property (as e.g. light) can be varied
examples: variable filters in front of the mercury xenon lights
